claim: Each California continuation school corresponding to the three lowest eligible free rates for students aged 5–17 provides a full-time on-site social worker and a licensed school nurse.
extra_info: Eligible free rates for students aged 5-17 = `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)` / `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`
reasoning: The database does not contain any information about school staffing such as social workers or school nurses. While continuation schools and eligible free rates can be identified from the frpm and schools tables, the claim's core assertion about 'full-time on-site social worker' and 'licensed school nurse' references concepts entirely absent from the database schema (OUT-OF-SCHEMA).

content.text:
I need to analyze this claim carefully. It mentions two things:
1. Finding California continuation schools with the three lowest eligible free rates for students aged 5-17
2. Whether these schools provide a "full-time on-site social worker" and a "licensed school nurse"

Let me first explore the database schema to see what information is available.

input.description: List all tables in the database
Get full schema of the database

content.content:
CREATE TABLE frpm
(
    CDSCode                                       TEXT not null
        primary key,
    `Academic Year`                               TEXT  null,
    `County Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `District Code`                               INTEGER         null,
    `School Code`                                 TEXT  null,
    `County Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Name`                               TEXT null,
    `School Name`                                 TEXT null,
    `District Type`                               TEXT null,
    `School Type`                                 TEXT null,
    `Educational Option Type`                     TEXT null,
    `NSLP Provision Status`                       TEXT null,
    `Charter School (Y/N)`                        INTEGER    null,
    `Charter School Number`                       TEXT  null,
    `Charter Funding Type`                        TEXT null,
    IRC                                           INTEGER    null,
    `Low Grade`                                   TEXT  null,
    `High Grade`                                  TEXT null,
    `Enrollment (K-12)`                           REAL      null,
    `Free Meal Count (K-12)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (K-12)`                           REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (K-12)`            REAL       null,
    `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)`                 REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible Free (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `FRPM Count (Ages 5-17)`                      REAL       null,
    `Percent (%) Eligible FRPM (Ages 5-17)`       REAL       null,
    `2013-14 CALPADS Fall 1 Certification Status` INTEGER    null,
    foreign key (CDSCode) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE satscores
(
    cds         TEXT not null
        primary key,
    rtype       TEXT  not null,
    sname       TEXT null,
    dname       TEXT null,
    cname       TEXT null,
    enroll12    INTEGER         not null,
    NumTstTakr  INTEGER          not null,
    AvgScrRead  INTEGER          null,
    AvgScrMath  INTEGER          null,
    AvgScrWrite INTEGER          null,
    NumGE1500   INTEGER          null,
--     PctGE1500   double      null,
        foreign key (cds) references schools (CDSCode)
);
CREATE TABLE schools
(
    CDSCode     TEXT not null
        primary key,
    NCESDist    TEXT  null,
    NCESSchool  TEXT  null,
    StatusType  TEXT  not null,
    County      TEXT not null,
    District    TEXT not null,
    School      TEXT null,
    Street      TEXT null,
    StreetAbr   TEXT null,
    City        TEXT null,
    Zip         TEXT null,
    State       TEXT  null,
    MailStreet  TEXT null,
    MailStrAbr  TEXT null,
    MailCity    TEXT null,
    MailZip     TEXT null,
    MailState   TEXT  null,
    Phone       TEXT null,
    Ext         TEXT  null,
    Website     TEXT null,
    OpenDate    DATE        null,
    ClosedDate  DATE        null,
    Charter     INTEGER    null,
    CharterNum  TEXT  null,
    FundingType TEXT null,
    DOC         TEXT  not null,
    DOCType     TEXT not null,
    SOC         TEXT  null,
    SOCType     TEXT null,
    EdOpsCode   TEXT  null,
    EdOpsName   TEXT null,
    EILCode     TEXT  null,
    EILName     TEXT null,
    GSoffered   TEXT null,
    GSserved    TEXT  null,
    Virtual     TEXT  null,
    Magnet      INTEGER   null,
    Latitude    REAL      null,
    Longitude   REAL      null,
    AdmFName1   TEXT null,
    AdmLName1   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail1   TEXT null,
    AdmFName2   TEXT null,
    AdmLName2   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail2   TEXT null,
    AdmFName3   TEXT  null,
    AdmLName3   TEXT null,
    AdmEmail3   TEXT null,
    LastUpdate  DATE        not null
);

content.text:
Now I can see the schema. The claim mentions two specific attributes:
1. "Full-time on-site social worker" 
2. "Licensed school nurse"

Let me check if there are any columns in the database related to social workers or school nurses.

Looking at the schema, there are **no columns** in any of the three tables (`frpm`, `satscores`, `schools`) that track whether a school has a social worker or a school nurse. The database contains information about school demographics, free meal programs, SAT scores, and basic school information (location, type, dates, etc.), but nothing about staffing such as social workers or nurses.

The first part of the claim (identifying continuation schools with the three lowest eligible free rates) can be computed from the data. But the second part — whether these schools provide "a full-time on-site social worker and a licensed school nurse" — references information that is entirely absent from the database schema.

This is an **OUT-OF-SCHEMA** situation: the claim makes assertions about staffing (social workers, nurses) that cannot be verified from this database.
